chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jason D Barnhill in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss and read-in. Court grants and the matter is dismissed and read-in.

Pro se letter reviewed by Judge Maxwell.  No action taken.  Defendant represented by counsel.  Counsel for Defendant provided copy of letter.

Defendant Jason D Barnhill in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Speedy Trial Demand is withdrawn by the defense. Defendant Jason D Barnhill in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason D Barnhill in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  Village of Hartland Detective Paula Hoffa sworn and testifies on direct by Attorney Juech.  Cross examination by Attorney Fragoso.  State rests and moves for bind over.  Closing statements.  Attorney Fragoso moves to dismiss.  Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Bail remains as fixed.  Arraignment scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to have no contact with any child under the age of 18.
